body: There are more, there is at least one in the `mentoring.rst` doc that had also expired, as @arvind has pointed out. We should to a full respository search and ensure that all links are updated. @arvind has offered to look into this, thanks!
oh, very sorry, @arvind. I then presume that your discord name is not identical to your GitHub ID. Apologies for the spam.
Hii, I will work on it and send a PR soon
@Arvind644 you can just copy the link from README, I created that and it has now no expiration date :)
Hello there, it appears that this Slack link (https://sktime-group.slack.com/join/shared_invite/zt-62i7aejn-vXc3nOWF26S_P3VXFPWisQ#/shared-invite/error) on the README is also expired:

is it expired again?
Let's fix it. Why did we not close this issue back then?

~Looks like this PR was reverted for some reason: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/3017/files . If you look at the invite ID, the one in `main` README right now is what should have been relaced in #3017.~ Nope looks like it was just a link that wasn't noticed. #3449

how odd - can you kindly open a PR that replaces the expired link with the permanent one? That would be great!
Otherwise a core dev will do it later.

issue.title: [DOC] Expired slack link under "Where to ask questions"

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
Fixes expired link to Slack under the "Where to ask questions" section of the README.

Related to #3014
